title: Laser and stereo data misalignment (unrelated to diff between visual and collision geom)

content.raw:
I have the latest drcsim-nightly installed and get sensor data as shown in the attached image. LIDAR points are consistently too short range when compared to stereo point clouds. As can be seen from the image and comparing the object's position in relation to the robot's feet, the stereo data seems to be correct, while the LIDAR data apparently is wrong.

To reproduce:

* Spawn a Atlas:
```
roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch
```
* Let it look downwards (I did that using the joint dialog in gazebo)
* Make the LIDAR spin
```
rostopic pub --once /multisense_sl/set_spindle_speed std_msgs/Float64 '{data: 3.0}'
```
* Insert some objects
* Visualize both the stereo point cloud and LIDAR data with a decay time != 0 (for better visibility)

Any idea  on what is happening or even better, a fix, would be greatly appreciated.
